Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech and expression.
No single group should have the authority to decide what can be said.
Skepticism and diverse perspectives are essential for understanding and progress.
Freedom of speech should only be limited if it directly harms or kills people.
There is insufficient long-term data to conclusively support claims about climate change.
The legislation is seen as a move towards centralized control and suppression of dissent.
